document_data.name: Farrel's Fine Jewelry and Apparel
document_data.services: Fine fabrics, furs, jewelry for sale
document_data.mainbody: '''Farrel's Fine Jewelry and Apparel''' was a high-end outset shop located in the town of [[Daggerford]] during the 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. It was run by [[Farrel]], a representative of a [[Waterdhavian]] trade consortium.
document_data.Location: The shop was located in Daggerford's [[Money Quarter]] in central Daggerford along the [[Hill Road]].{{Cite interactive atlas|3990 Daggerford}}
document_data.Services: The shop offered high quality textiles such as [[silk]] and furs that were imported from far away realms. Farrel was always looking to buy unique pieces of jewelry, either mundane or [[magic]]al in nature, and sell them for exorbitant prices.
